FeedItems.Title: NuGet.org will continue to support TLS 1.0 and 1.1 until further notice

FeedItems.Summary: We are excited to announce that nuget.org now supports package deprecation. This has been a long standing ask that will help the ecosystem use supported packages. As a package publisher on nuget.org,...

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Cookie Compliance] Finish the implementation on the front-end side." (#8171) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "[Cookie Compliance] Finish the implementation on the front-end side." (#8171) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Merged pull request "Store embedded readme file to storage" (#8166) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Summary of the changes:

* Store embedded readme into readmes container

No change in terms of displaying view model, use the current implementation to display 

Display embedded readme on details page
![display](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64443925/90726901-50a1fb80-e277-11ea-93bf-a9fbbe64a665.PNG)


Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/3266

Nuget is installed, just not for me... 😣

ugh, i know... so instead of trying to cunstruct an application (that's how i got into this mess) i'm receptive to asking for help. there's quite a few `F ups but right now i need to remotely access my laptop in order to fix. Please, be kind to my mess. It's mine and i own that mess. i need help cleaning up the mess i have made out of my life.

G

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Update the SPDX license list" (#9946) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: The spdx license list is not up to date and needs updated with the latest version.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "spec for dotnet signature-related subcommands" (#9945) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "Address possible break of project installation after retry install due to certain incompatible framework" (#9944) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
Worked before? N/A
During my performance improvement work #[PR3559](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3559) Nikolche [pointed out](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3559/files#r475033357) potential bug where initially success installation package break due to re-evaluation.

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem
N/A : Not sure it's just possible bug.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "allowUntrustedRoot not respected on Linux" (#9942) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I'm validating a package signed with a self-signed-certificate that is trusted in nuget.config with `allowUntrustedRoot=true`

I can add/restore with dotnet on Windows, but in Linux it fails with

```
The author primary signature found a chain building issue: PartialChain: unable to get local issuer certificate
```
<details>
```
dotnet add package System.Rido -v 1.0.8-pre
  Determining projects to restore...
  Writing /tmp/tmpn6Jdws.tmp
info : Adding PackageReference for package 'System.Rido' into project '/home/rido/code/secure-packages-demo/MyConsoleApp/MyConsoleApp.csproj'.
info : Restoring packages for /home/rido/code/secure-packages-demo/MyConsoleApp/MyConsoleApp.csproj...
info :   CACHE https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/microsoft.aspnetcore.app.ref/index.json
info :   CACHE https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/microsoft.netcore.app.ref/index.json
info : Installing Microsoft.NETCore.App.Ref 3.0.0.
info :   CACHE https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/microsoft.netcore.app.ref/3.0.0/microsoft.netcore.app.ref.3.0.0.nupkg
info : Installing Microsoft.AspNetCore.App.Ref 3.0.1.
info :   CACHE https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/microsoft.aspnetcore.app.ref/3.0.1/microsoft.aspnetcore.app.ref.3.0.1.nupkg
info : Installing System.Rido 1.0.8-pre.
info : Package 'System.Rido 1.0.8-pre' from source '/home/rido/code/secure-packages-demo/_pkgs': Signature Hash Algorithm: SHA256
info : Package 'System.Rido 1.0.8-pre' from source '/home/rido/code/secure-packages-demo/_pkgs': Timestamp: 03/10/2019 23:25:34
info : Package 'System.Rido 1.0.8-pre' from source '/home/rido/code/secure-packages-demo/_pkgs': Verifying author primary signature's timestamp with timestamping service certificate: 
info :   Subject Name: CN=DigiCert SHA2 Timestamp Responder, O=DigiCert, C=US
info :   SHA1 hash: 400191475C98891DEBA104AF47091B5EB6D4CBCB
info :   SHA256 hash: FC834D5BFFDE31DBA5B79BF95F573F7953BCBF9156E8525163E828EB92EA8A93
info :   Issued by: CN=DigiCert SHA2 Assured ID Timestamping CA, OU=www.digicert.com, O=DigiCert Inc, C=US
info :   Valid from: 01/03/2017 16:00:00 to 01/17/2028 16:00:00
info : Package 'System.Rido 1.0.8-pre' from source '/home/rido/code/secure-packages-demo/_pkgs': Signature type: Author
info : Package 'System.Rido 1.0.8-pre' from source '/home/rido/code/secure-packages-demo/_pkgs': Verifying the author primary signature with certificate: 
info :   Subject Name: CN=Ringo, OU=Beatles
info :   SHA1 hash: F275ADE1D47A0419AC8B5F93D41932E8C3FE8B97
info :   SHA256 hash: F6B6EF6F6A9C60BC4B0A181A140C8CF1BA849B30C500FDD44F77A4C1672904B3
info :   Issued by: CN=Ringo, OU=Beatles
info :   Valid from: 02/13/2019 14:55:24 to 02/13/2020 15:15:24
error: Package 'System.Rido 1.0.8-pre' from source '/home/rido/code/secure-packages-demo/_pkgs': The author primary signature found a chain building issue: PartialChain: unable to get local issuer certificate
info : Package 'System.Rido' is compatible with all the specified frameworks in project '/home/rido/code/secure-packages-demo/MyConsoleApp/MyConsoleApp.csproj'.
error: Value cannot be null. (Parameter 'path1')
```
</details>

Repro Steps

1. Download this package to a local folder https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ridomin/secure-packages-demo/master/_pkgs/System.Rido.1.0.8-pre.nupkg 
1. `dotnet new console -o  myConsole`
1. add a  nuget.config to configure signing, local package source and trusted signers (see below)
1. `dotnet add package System.Rido -v 1.0.8-pre`

Expected. The package is installed (same behavior as in Windows)
Observed. The error above

Sample NuGet.Config
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<configuration>
 <packageSources>
    <clear />
    <add key="nuget" value="https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" />
   <add key="_pkgs" value="./_pkgs" />
 </packageSources>
  <config>
    <add key="signatureValidationMode" value="require" />
    <add key="globalPackagesFolder" value="~/.nuget/TrustedPackages" />
  </config>
  <trustedSigners>
    <author name="Ringo">
      <certificate fingerprint="F6B6EF6F6A9C60BC4B0A181A140C8CF1BA849B30C500FDD44F77A4C1672904B3"
                    hashAlgorithm="SHA256" allowUntrustedRoot="true" />
    </author>
  </trustedSigners>
</configuration>

```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "allowUntrustedRoot not respected on Linux" (#9942) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I'm validating a package signed with a self-signed-certificate that is trusted in nuget.config with `allowUntrustedRoot=true`

I can add/restore with dotnet on Windows, but in Linux it fails with

```
The author primary signature found a chain building issue: PartialChain: unable to get local issuer certificate
```
<details>
```
dotnet add package System.Rido -v 1.0.8-pre
  Determining projects to restore...
  Writing /tmp/tmpn6Jdws.tmp
info : Adding PackageReference for package 'System.Rido' into project '/home/rido/code/secure-packages-demo/MyConsoleApp/MyConsoleApp.csproj'.
info : Restoring packages for /home/rido/code/secure-packages-demo/MyConsoleApp/MyConsoleApp.csproj...

info :   Subject Name: CN=DigiCert SHA2 Timestamp Responder, O=DigiCert, C=US
info :   SHA1 hash: 400191475C98891DEBA104AF47091B5EB6D4CBCB
info :   SHA256 hash: FC834D5BFFDE31DBA5B79BF95F573F7953BCBF9156E8525163E828EB92EA8A93
info :   Issued by: CN=DigiCert SHA2 Assured ID Timestamping CA, OU=www.digicert.com, O=DigiCert Inc, C=US
info :   Valid from: 01/03/2017 16:00:00 to 01/17/2028 16:00:00
info : Package 'System.Rido 1.0.8-pre' from source '/home/rido/code/secure-packages-demo/_pkgs': Signature type: Author
info : Package 'System.Rido 1.0.8-pre' from source '/home/rido/code/secure-packages-demo/_pkgs': Verifying the author primary signature with certificate: 
info :   Subject Name: CN=Ringo, OU=Beatles
info :   SHA1 hash: F275ADE1D47A0419AC8B5F93D41932E8C3FE8B97
info :   SHA256 hash: F6B6EF6F6A9C60BC4B0A181A140C8CF1BA849B30C500FDD44F77A4C1672904B3
info :   Issued by: CN=Ringo, OU=Beatles
info :   Valid from: 02/13/2019 14:55:24 to 02/13/2020 15:15:24
error: Package 'System.Rido 1.0.8-pre' from source '/home/rido/code/secure-packages-demo/_pkgs': The author primary signature found a chain building issue: PartialChain: unable to get local issuer certificate
info : Package 'System.Rido' is compatible with all the specified frameworks in project '/home/rido/code/secure-packages-demo/MyConsoleApp/MyConsoleApp.csproj'.
error: Value cannot be null. (Parameter 'path1')
```
</details>

Repro Steps

1. Download this package to a local folder https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ridomin/secure-packages-demo/master/_pkgs/System.Rido.1.0.8-pre.nupkg 
1. `dotnet new console -o  myConsole`
1. add a  nuget.config to configure signing, local package source and trusted signers (see below)
1. `dotnet add package System.Rido -v 1.0.8-pre`

Expected. The package is installed (same behavior as in Windows)
Observed. The error above

Sample NuGet.Config
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<configuration>
 <packageSources>
    <clear />
    <add key="nuget" value="https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" />
   <add key="_pkgs" value="./_pkgs" />
 </packageSources>
  <config>
    <add key="signatureValidationMode" value="require" />

                    hashAlgorithm="SHA256" allowUntrustedRoot="true" />
    </author>
  </trustedSigners>
</configuration>

```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "dotnet on Linux incorrectly detects revoked certificates on signed packages." (#9941) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
The package https://www.nuget.org/packages/Rido.CoreAppLauncher/0.0.1-Beta1 is signed with author and repo certificates.

NuGet.exe  5.4.0.6315 reports the package as valid
```
Successfully verified package 'Rido.CoreAppLauncher.0.0.1-Beta1'.
```
<details>
Verifying Rido.CoreAppLauncher.0.0.1-Beta1
C:\Users\rido\Downloads\rido.coreapplauncher.0.0.1-beta1.nupkg

Signature Hash Algorithm: SHA256
Timestamp: 11/7/2018 8:31:32 PM

Verifying author primary signature's timestamp with timestamping service certificate:
  Subject Name: CN=DigiCert SHA2 Timestamp Responder, O=DigiCert, C=US
  SHA1 hash: 400191475C98891DEBA104AF47091B5EB6D4CBCB
  SHA256 hash: FC834D5BFFDE31DBA5B79BF95F573F7953BCBF9156E8525163E828EB92EA8A93
  Issued by: CN=DigiCert SHA2 Assured ID Timestamping CA, OU=www.digicert.com, O=DigiCert Inc, C=US
  Valid from: 1/3/2017 4:00:00 PM to 1/17/2028 4:00:00 PM

Verifying the author primary signature with certificate:
  Subject Name: CN=Ricardo Minguez, O=Ricardo Minguez, L=Redmond, S=Washington, C=US
  SHA1 hash: AF227A682A7A39B3E21740C6C42C27E56312D3D8
  SHA256 hash: 518F74AE79E44C7451FB5013E63D46BFF967A11AA13CD8F4586C57059AE900C9
  Issued by: CN=DigiCert SHA2 Assured ID Code Signing CA, OU=www.digicert.com, O=DigiCert Inc, C=US
  Valid from: 7/11/2018 5:00:00 PM to 10/11/2019 5:00:00 AM

Timestamp: 11/7/2018 8:36:43 PM

Verifying repository countersignature's timestamp with timestamping service certificate:
  Subject Name: CN=Symantec SHA256 TimeStamping Signer - G2, OU=Symantec Trust Network, O=Symantec Corporation, C=US
  SHA1 hash: 625AEC3AE4EDA1D169C4EE909E85B3BBC61076D3
  SHA256 hash: CF7AC17AD047ECD5FDC36822031B12D4EF078B6F2B4C5E6BA41F8FF2CF4BAD67
  Issued by: CN=Symantec SHA256 TimeStamping CA, OU=Symantec Trust Network, O=Symantec Corporation, C=US
  Valid from: 1/1/2017 4:00:00 PM to 4/1/2028 4:59:59 PM

Signature type: Repository
nuget-v3-service-index-url: https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json
nuget-package-owners: ridomin
Verifying the repository countersignature with certificate:
  Subject Name: CN=NuGet.org Repository by Microsoft, O=NuGet.org Repository by Microsoft, L=Redmond, S=Washington, C=US
  SHA1 hash: 8FB6D7FCF7AD49EB774446EFE778B33365BB7BFB
  SHA256 hash: 0E5F38F57DC1BCC806D8494F4F90FBCEDD988B46760709CBEEC6F4219AA6157D
  Issued by: CN=DigiCert SHA2 Assured ID Code Signing CA, OU=www.digicert.com, O=DigiCert Inc, C=US
  Valid from: 4/9/2018 5:00:00 PM to 4/14/2021 5:00:00 AM


Successfully verified package 'Rido.CoreAppLauncher.0.0.1-Beta1'.
</details>

When trying to install the same package in Ubuntu 20 (WSL2) with `dotnet 5.0.100-preview.8.20417.9` I got the following error

```
error: Package 'Rido.CoreAppLauncher 0.0.1-Beta1' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The author primary signature found a chain building issue: Revoked: certificate revoked
```

<details>
```
dotnet add package rido.coreapplauncher -v 0.0.1-beta1

  Determining projects to restore...
  Writing /tmp/tmpn2UntS.tmp
info : Adding PackageReference for package 'rido.coreapplauncher' into project '/home/rido/code/testcons/testcons.csproj'.
info : Restoring packages for /home/rido/code/testcons/testcons.csproj...
info :   GET https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/rido.coreapplauncher/index.json

info :   OK https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/rido.coreapplauncher/0.0.1-beta1/rido.coreapplauncher.0.0.1-beta1.nupkg 10ms
info : Installing Rido.CoreAppLauncher 0.0.1-Beta1.
info : Package 'Rido.CoreAppLauncher 0.0.1-Beta1' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': Signature Hash Algorithm: SHA256

info :   Subject Name: CN=DigiCert SHA2 Timestamp Responder, O=DigiCert, C=US

info :   SHA256 hash: FC834D5BFFDE31DBA5B79BF95F573F7953BCBF9156E8525163E828EB92EA8A93
info :   Issued by: CN=DigiCert SHA2 Assured ID Timestamping CA, OU=www.digicert.com, O=DigiCert Inc, C=US
info :   Valid from: 01/03/2017 16:00:00 to 01/17/2028 16:00:00
info : Package 'Rido.CoreAppLauncher 0.0.1-Beta1' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': Signature type: Author
info : Package 'Rido.CoreAppLauncher 0.0.1-Beta1' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': Verifying the author primary signature with certificate:
info :   Subject Name: CN=Ricardo Minguez, O=Ricardo Minguez, L=Redmond, S=Washington, C=US

info :   SHA256 hash: 518F74AE79E44C7451FB5013E63D46BFF967A11AA13CD8F4586C57059AE900C9
info :   Issued by: CN=DigiCert SHA2 Assured ID Code Signing CA, OU=www.digicert.com, O=DigiCert Inc, C=US
info :   Valid from: 07/11/2018 17:00:00 to 10/11/2019 05:00:00
error: Package 'Rido.CoreAppLauncher 0.0.1-Beta1' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The author primary signature found a chain building issue: Revoked: certificate revoked
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet assembly versions should be consistent" (#8113) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
After adjusting the Visual Studio installation path (on the first line below) as necessary, execute the following PowerShell script:
```PowerShell
$directory = [System.IO.DirectoryInfo]::new('C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\Enterprise\Common7\IDE\CommonExtensions\Microsoft\NuGet')

$files = $directory.GetFiles('NuGet.*.dll')

$assemblyVersionsMap = [System.Collections.Generic.SortedDictionary[string, [System.Collections.Hashtable]]]::new()

ForEach ($file In $files)
{
    $assembly = [System.Reflection.Assembly]::LoadFile($file.FullName)
    $assemblyName = [System.Reflection.AssemblyName]::new($assembly.FullName)
    $fileVersionInfo = [System.Diagnostics.FileVersionInfo]::GetVersionInfo($file.FullName)
    $versions = @{
        AssemblyVersion = $assemblyName.Version
        FileVersion = $fileVersionInfo.FileVersion
        ProductVersion = $fileVersionInfo.ProductVersion
    }

    $assemblyVersionsMap.Add($assemblyName.Name, $versions)
}

$assemblyVersionsMap | Format-Table `
    @{ Label = 'Assembly';         Expression = 'Key' }, `
    @{ Label = 'Assembly Version'; Expression = { $_.Value.AssemblyVersion } }, `
    @{ Label = 'File Version';     Expression = { $_.Value.FileVersion } }, `
    @{ Label = 'Product Version';  Expression = { $_.Value.ProductVersion } }
```
Sample output:

Assembly | Assembly Version | File Version | Product Version
--- | --- | --- | ---
NuGet.Build.Tasks | 5.0.0.6 | 5.0.0.5917 | 5.0.0-rtm.5917+f2696527402305a7d7e51ca2aab1dc1c704d7c68
NuGet.Commands | 5.0.0.6 | 5.0.0.5917 | 5.0.0-rtm.5917+f2696527402305a7d7e51ca2aab1dc1c704d7c68
NuGet.Common | 5.0.0.6 | 5.0.0.5917 | 5.0.0-rtm.5917+f2696527402305a7d7e51ca2aab1dc1c704d7c68
NuGet.Configuration | 5.0.0.6 | 5.0.0.5917 | 5.0.0-rtm.5917+f2696527402305a7d7e51ca2aab1dc1c704d7c68
NuGet.Console | **5.0.0.5917** | 5.0.0.5917 | 5.0.0-rtm.5917+f2696527402305a7d7e51ca2aab1dc1c704d7c68
NuGet.Credentials | 5.0.0.6 | 5.0.0.5917 | 5.0.0-rtm.5917+f2696527402305a7d7e51ca2aab1dc1c704d7c68
NuGet.DependencyResolver.Core | 5.0.0.6 | 5.0.0.5917 | 5.0.0-rtm.5917+f2696527402305a7d7e51ca2aab1dc1c704d7c68
NuGet.Frameworks | 5.0.0.6 | 5.0.0.5917 | 5.0.0-rtm.5917+f2696527402305a7d7e51ca2aab1dc1c704d7c68
NuGet.Indexing | 5.0.0.6 | 5.0.0.5917 | 5.0.0-rtm.5917+f2696527402305a7d7e51ca2aab1dc1c704d7c68
NuGet.LibraryModel | 5.0.0.6 | 5.0.0.5917 | 5.0.0-rtm.5917+f2696527402305a7d7e51ca2aab1dc1c704d7c68

NuGet.VisualStudio.Interop.dll's assembly version should always be 1.0.0.0; however, I'm not aware of any good reason why all other assemblies don't have the same assembly version of 5.0.0.6.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Importing MSBuild Targets from Referenced Package" (#9938) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I have a project "Foo.Theme" which has the following defined in the "Foo.Theme.csproj" file:

```
<ItemGroup>
  <ProjectReference Include="..\Foo.Module\Foo.Module.csproj" />
</ItemGroup>

<ItemGroup>
  <None Include="Foo.Theme.props" Pack="true">
    <PackagePath>build\$(TargetFramework)\Foo.Theme.props</PackagePath>
  </None>
</ItemGroup>
```

Where the "Foo.Module" project has the following defined in it's "Foo.Module.csproj" file:

```
<ItemGroup>
  <None Include="Foo.Module.props" Pack="true">
    <PackagePath>build\$(TargetFramework)\Foo.Module.props</PackagePath>
  </None>
</ItemGroup>
```

Now if I add a package reference to "Foo.Theme" it correctly imports the targets from the "Foo.Theme.props" file within the package. However it's not importing the "Foo.Module.props" targets.

I can add a package reference to "Foo.Module" aswell but I thought since "Foo.Theme" has a reference to "Foo.Module" it would should work without having to reference both.

I'd appreciate it if somone could explain why this is the case and a possibly solution. Thanks

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet pack should reject duplicated entries in the same directory" (#9939) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Please read the following information before posting the issue.

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): Any nuget path that can pack.

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): Any recent nuget version.

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

It is possible to create a package that contains multiple files with the same name in the same directory. This cannot be unpacked on any operating system in a predictable manner, and a push to nuget.org fails.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Exclude specific reference from transitive dependencies" (#9916) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
If we have package A with dependency on package B (A -> B).

And if we have something like this in `MyProject.csproj` file:

```xlm
<ItemGroup>
  <PackageReference Include="A" Version="1.0.0" />
</ItemGroup>
```

this will automatically reference package B and package B will be downloaded from nuget repository.

I wont to manually reference package `B.dll` from my "D:\lib\" folder.

if I do this in `MyProject.csproj`:

```xlm
<ItemGroup>
  <PackageReference Include="A" Version="1.0.0" />
</ItemGroup>
<ItemGroup>
  <Reference Include="B">
    <HintPath>D:\lib\B.dll</HintPath>
  </Reference>
</ItemGroup>
```

I still get "B.dll" from nuget repository instead from "D:\lib\" folder.

How to solve this? How to tell package A does not include package B as reference in the project. Is there something like this:

```xlm
<ItemGroup>
  <PackageReference Include="A" Version="1.0.0">
    <Exclude Path="**\B.dll" />
  </PackageReference>
</ItemGroup>
<ItemGroup>
  <Reference Include="B">
    <HintPath>D:\lib\B.dll</HintPath>
  </Reference>
</ItemGroup>
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "CVE-2020-1340 - NuGet Gallery Spoofing Vulnerability" (#45) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
A spoofing vulnerability exists when the NuGet Gallery does not properly sanitize input on package metadata values. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could perform cross-site scripting attacks and run scripts in the security context of the user viewing the malicious content.

To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker with permissions to upload packages could publish specially crafted content on a gallery page.

The security update addresses the vulnerability by correcting how NuGet Gallery sanitizes input.

**MSRC Security Guidance:** [CVE-2020-1340](https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-1340)
**Security Update:** [v2020.06.09](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/releases/tag/v2020.06.09)
